quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Gin and Meld
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, discard, making. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of seafood is used in the making of the Korean salad Golbaengi muchim?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the gin rummy game you should never pick up a speculative discard. That is, you should never pick up a discard without using it in a meld.
If your opponent in the game gin rummy picked up the jack of spades and discarded the queen of spades, what could you conclude?

options.text: She doesnt know how to play gin.
She most certainly is collecting jacks.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She probably is collecting jacks.

questions.question: All other things being equal, which 3-card meld is more likely to be increased to a 4-card meld in the game gin rummy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eight Nine Ten of Diamonds

questions.question: The best gin rummy players remember every card played.
There are several variations of gin rummy commonly played. Which of the following is INCORRECT?

options.text: In Knock Rummy, all face cards are worth 10, and all other cards are worth their face value.
In Oklahoma Gin the first up card determines the maximum knock value.
In Knock Rummy you can go out even though not all of your cards are used in melds.
In conventional Gin Rummy a Queen-King-Ace meld is worth more than a 4-5-6 meld.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In conventional Gin Rummy a Queen-King-Ace meld is worth more than a 4-5-6 meld.

questions.question: In the gin rummy game which of the following is a triangle?

options.text: 7 of hearts, 8 of clubs, 7 of spades
7 of hearts, 8 of hearts, 6 of hearts
7 of hearts, 8 of hearts, 7 of spades
7 of hearts, 8 of clubs, 8 of diamonds

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7 of hearts, 8 of hearts, 7 of spades

questions.question: In the card game gin rummy, it is sometimes necessary to break a meld in order to keep your opponent from winning the hand.
The Larb meat salad belongs to the cuisine of what Asian country?
If my opponent in gin rummy has picked up the 8 of diamonds, and I know nothing else about my opponents hand, which of the following cards should I discard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7 of spades

questions.question: What kind of cheese is one of the ingredients of the Insalata Caprese salad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo mozzarella

questions.question: In knock rummy, deciding whether to knock or go for gin can be difficult. Which of the following is INCORRECT?

options.text: Sometimes it makes sense to knock even if theres a strong possibility that your opponent will undercut you.
If you wait for gin and your opponent knocks, you might be able to undercut her.
If you have reason to believe that your opponents unused cards are low cards, you should probably knock if you can.
If its early in the hand and you can knock, you probably should do so.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: If you have reason to believe that your opponents unused cards are low cards, you should probably knock if you can.

questions.question: What does the name of the Chinese salad Yusheng mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raw fish

questions.question: Why is the popular US salad Crab Louie called so?

options.text: It was named after its creator.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It includes crab meat.

questions.question: What is the main ingredient of the Ambrosia salad?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Hairstyle and Card
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, mohawk, brazil. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the other common name of the punk Mohawk hairstyle?
This is a variety of ring-shaped pasta, typically stuffed with a mix of meat and usually served in broth, with cream, or sometimes with a ragù. It originated in the Italian region of Emilia.
In Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Paraguay, Uruguay, and Venezuela, where Italian cuisine is especially popular, there is a custom to eat this traditional Italian pasta on the 29th day of each month.
In which of these hairstyles the sides and back of the hair are kept short, while the front is kept long and combed forward?
What is the popular Buzz haircut commonly called in Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crew cut

questions.question: This pastas name is the Italian word for little bell. It has fluted, petal-like edges and a hollow center for capturing sauce. It is usually found in a casserole or served with a thick sauce.
What other common name is used to refer to the hairstyle known as a Croydon facelift?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Chonmage is a mans hairstyle traditional for this country.
This female artists signature beehive hairdo is widely spoofed and copied.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amy Winehouse

questions.question: What hairstyle combines the 1950s pompadour, the 50s flattop, and sometimes a mohawk?
What type of hairstyle is the so-called Fofa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A hairstyle for balding men

questions.question: All other things being equal, if you had a triangle, a 3-card meld and a 4-card meld, and drew a card which could expand the 3-card meld into a 4-card meld, you should expand the meld and discard one card of the triangle.
This small shell shaped pasta with slightly rolled-in edges is very popular in the Avellino province of Italy.
What popular man is also known as the king of the comb over due to his hairstyle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Robinson

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the Japanese word hime which refers to a popular cut?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tomatoes and Type
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, festival, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Tomato juice is the official beverage of this state in the USA.
Tomatoes can be refrigerated and they will continue to ripen after they reach room temperature.

This type of  flat pasta, representing medallion or coin, stamped with various patterns originated in Liguria, Northern Italy during the Middle Ages. It was made by local peasants and used by aristocratic families as a display of wealth and status.
This type of macaroni is formed in a spiral tube shape an typically has lines on the outside surface.
These are rectangular pasta sheets rolled with a savory stuffing and then covered with a sauce.
Which of these is not a corkscrew-shaped pasta?
According to some studies, lycopene, which is found in tomatoes, prevents this disease.
The name of this thick noodle made of egg and flour means little ribbon in Italian. It is very popular in Rome and is similar to what is called tagliatelle elsewhere in Italy.
In what country is the popular tomato festival called La Tomatina celebrated annually?
What country was the largest producer of tomatoes in the world in 2008?
Which of this is the general name for the type of pasta shaped as swirls?
Most tomato cultivars produce fruit that is red when ripe, but some produce unusual colors such as this one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What chemical is used to trigger the ripening of tomatoes that have been picked unripe?
What continent did tomatoes originate from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

questions.question: In 1994 Calgene introduced this genetically modified tomato cultivar which could be vine ripened without shortening the shelf life of the tomatoes.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Year and Animals
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, confucius, tomato. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If you were born in the year 1976, 1988 or 2000, what would your lunar sign be?
According to Chinese astrology, why is it considered to be a poor match, if your partner is six years older or younger than you?

options.text: The signs are not a part of a perfect triangle creating balance.
The signs are directly opposite each other.
The years you were born in are represented by the same animal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The signs are directly opposite each other.

questions.question: If you were born in 1982, 1994 or 2006, what would your lunar sign be?
What are the only insects that are allowed to be consumed according to Jewish dietary laws?
Members of the Special Air Service of the British Army are forbidden to eat only this type of meat.
If you were born in 1972, with the current year being 2008, the next time your year in the Chinese Zodiac will come around, is 2020.
According to the Chinese Zodiac, the year of the cat occurred in 2000.
It is considered that the consumption of these animals transmitted a predecessor of HIV to humans.
According to legend, what year is the luckiest year to be born in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the year of the dragon

questions.question: What part of the tomato plant does not contain Solanine, a poison toxic to humans and animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ripe fruit

questions.question: According to a legend, when Confucius died, twelve animals rushed to his bedside. The order of the Chinese Horoscope is the order in which they arrived. What was the first animal to arrive at Confucius bedside?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the rat

questions.question: If you were born in 1980, 1992 or 2004, what would your lunar sign be?
According to the Chinese Zodiac, what is the last year in the twelve-year cycle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the year of the boar

questions.question: If you were born in 1978, 1990 or 2002, what would your lunar sign be?
If you were born in 1981, 1993 or 2005, what would your lunar sign be?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Beer and Broccoli
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, kind, shots. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1953, this New Zealander developed the technique of continuous fermentation, which is applied in the production of the famous beer brand Guinness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morton W. Coutts

questions.question: The most common type of broccoli is sometimes referred to with this term in the United Kingdom.
This kind of beer, produced from wild yeast through a process called spontaneous fermentation, has a distinctive, cidery flavour with slightly sour aftertaste.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: lambic beer

questions.question: Broccoli looks very similar to this vegetable and is often confused with it.
Broccoli originated in this country about 2000 years ago.
This is a drinking game played with 1 oz shots of beer and cards. The player must guess the rank that was dealt to another players card. At the end, one of the players has to drink many beer shots.
What is the name of a traditional German wheat beer glass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weizenbier glass

questions.question: Malt, one of the main ingredients of beer, undergoes a process in which the grain kernels are crushed and later the smaller pieces are separated from the husk. What is the name of the resulting product?
This type of Belgian beer contains alcohol by volume, ranging between 8 an 11 percent. A commercial example for this kind of beer is Unibroue la Fin du Monde.
Which of the following brands of beer is not German and is manufactured in an Asian country?
What is the name of an alcoholic beverage consisting of equal parts of lager beer and lemonade?
What two positive adjectives best describe the snake, the 6th animal in the Chinese Zodiac?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wise, graceful

questions.question: The word broccoli comes from the Italian expression piccoli bracci. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little arms

questions.question: Which of these is a Polish beer brand, established in 1629?
This term refers to a kind of unfiltered beer, conditioned and served from the cask without additional pressure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cask ale beer

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Broccoli and Statements
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, content, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There are several types of broccoli that are very common around the world. Which of these is one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: 99% of the broccoli crop in U.S.A. is produced in these two states.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California and Arizona

questions.question: Which of these statements about the fat content of the coconut is true?

options.text: It contains high amounts of fat, but it does not contain saturated fats.
It doesnt contain any fat at all.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 90% of its fat is saturated.

questions.question: The cashew nutshell liquid, a by-product of cashew processing, contains anacardic acids, which are beneficial for the treatment of this medical problem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tooth abscesses

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about almonds?

options.text: The sweet almond contains no carbohydrates.
They lower LDL cholesterol, the bad cholesterol.
They are very rich in vitamin E.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What kind of disturbance can pine nuts cause in about 1 to 3 days following their consumption?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unusual taste in the mouth

questions.question: Broccoli is known for its cancer-fighting properties. Which of these compounds found in broccoli has an anti-cancer effect?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Walnuts are proven to lower the bad cholesterol due to this chemical compound found in them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Omega-3 fatty acids

questions.question: Broccoli is very rich in vitamins and other essential nutrients. Which of these vitamins does broccoli contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these names is used as an alternative name of hazelnuts?
What other use does the Brazil nut oil have, apart from being used for food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: To which of these countries is the pistachio tree native?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these vegetables is not a type of broccoli?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese broccoli

questions.question: Boiling broccoli for more than ten minutes reduces its beneficial properties. Which of these cooking methods is more appropriate for preserving its ingredients?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the chestnut fruit, which is not actually a nut?

options.text: Their starch content is equal to that of the potato.
It is the only nut that contains vitamin C.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the only nut that contains vitamin C.
